taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe pectidinae;genus thymophylla;species tenuiloba;variety tenuiloba

bio:treatment.description: Heavy soils or loams or sands, often with limestone, frequently ruderal along roadways and in other disturbed places;
Tex.; Mexico (Tamaulipas); introduced in West Indies, Asia, Africa.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety tenuiloba is relatively recently adventive in Alabama, Florida, Louisiana, Mississippi, Bahamas, West Indies (Cuba), Asia, and Africa.
The names Dahlberg daisy and golden fleece are recent coinages applied to cultivars of var. tenuiloba in the horticultural trade.
